Actions¶

class lena.action.Action(description: Optional[str] = None, name: Optional[str] = None)[source]¶

Fundamental entity which is designed to be chained with other actions so one action process the ActionData and send it to the next action.

property action_name¶
Returns

Name of the action

async async_run(action_data: lena.types.ActionDataT) → lena.types.ActionDataT[source]¶

Method which is executed when running the action pipeline

Note that each override of this function have to implement “skipping logic” to support Return functionality.

def run(self, action_data: ActionDataT) -> ActionDataT:
    if action_data.skip_processing:
        return action_data

    # normal implementation of the action
    ...
Parameters

action_data – Data container passed by actions

Returns

Last version of ~lena.entities.ActionData after execution

classmethod namespaced() → lena.types.NamespacedActionT[source]¶

Return ‘named’ instance of itself. It has no effect, just make a ‘title’ for the action/s by wrapping them into a named group of actions.

Example:

EventSet.namespaced().MarkPaymentAttemptAsProcessed(
        [SetPaymentAuthorizationAttemptProcessed(), SaveModel("authorization_attempt")]
    )

MarkPaymentAttemptAsProcessed is just a “made up” key of the following actions.

on_subfield(field_key: str) → lena.action.OnActionDataSubField[source]¶

Run action on a subfield. See OnActionDataSubField class for more information.

Parameters

field_key – Key to the item in ActionData on which the action will be executed

Returns

Wrapped action which will be executed on the subfield

then(another_action: lena.types.ActionT) → lena.types.ActionT[source]¶

One of the chaining functions. More convenient way for chaining is to use >> operator like this:

Action1() >> Action2()
Parameters

another_action – Another action which will be executed after

Returns

Set of this action and another_action represented by ActionSet

class lena.action.ActionSet(actions: Iterable[lena.types.ActionT], description: Optional[str] = None, name: Optional[str] = None)[source]¶

Set of actions which are executed consequently

class lena.action.OnActionDataSubField(action: lena.types.ActionT, field_key: str, name: Optional[str] = None)[source]¶

Utility action to execute an action on values of a nested item.

For example if an action accepts parameter user, but action data contains only request_data dictionary with the desired user.

action = OnActionDataSubField(DoSomethingWithUser(), field_key="request_data")

# Same as
action = DoSomethingWithUser().on_subfield("request_data")

As shown above on_subfield() can be used as a shortcut.

class lena.action.Return(action: Optional[lena.types.ActionT] = None)[source]¶

Mark action data as “should not be processed”, imitating return statement in functions
